Post Description:
Everybody wins, or one solution to rule them all?

Should undergrad case study exercises be an “everybody wins” situation, where all entrants receive a prize? Or should there be just one winner?

It was a lot of fun discussing this question with Matthew A. Lanham , Cody Baldwin , and Steven Moss at #INFORMS2023 in #phoenix.

Would love to hear from the audience: do plentiful prizes breed entitlement, or do they encourage those who might not otherwise participate?

Experiential learning, case studies and animation - all we need is you! 

#INFORMS2023

Post Description:
DataPrime will be this year's sponsor of Freestyle OR Supreme at #INFORMS Phoenix 2023.   Did we have you at DataPrime, or should we also mention sensor-fusion, mechatronics, distributed AI systems, and reinforcement learning with human feedback?  Swag and a trophy?

Come to hear special remarks and invitation to network with global AI influencers including Kirk Borne, Ph.D. , Jordan Morrow, and Aaron Burciaga, CAP, ACE. 

Swag and prizes for all participants!  Students and full spectrum of career (early to retired) professionals welcome to play.  

As preview and teaser to year's problem, come prepared to design the future of how AI systems and workforce can be optimized to ensure security and prosperity across industry, government, and academia. 

Sensor-fusion, mechatronics, distributed AI systems, and reinforcement learning with human feedback will take center stage in the full scenario and problem statement you and your team will compete to frame the problem and propose solutions using the INFORMS #JobTaskAnalysis framework. 

This real-world problem is perfect for the INFORMS Annual Meeting inasmuch that creative solutions, fresh perspectives, and spirited approaches will be needed to surmount the challenge presented on gameday! 

Register to compete! The members of the winning team will each receive the award shown here as well as recognition across social media by Kirk, Jordan, and Aaron of their victory and launch of an exciting young career!

Sign up here:  https://lnkd.in/gZCn8nsw

No prior experience is necessary; just sign up and show up to play.

You're invited: I'm delighted to be speaking at ProVisors' BADAM (Bay Area Distributors and Manufacturers) on Wednesday, September 6 at noon Pacific time. Post Description:
The 2024 application is OPEN for Full-Time MBA and M.S. in Business Analytics programs! 🎉 Click here to get started: https://bit.ly/3DIOUIU

▶️ Full-Time MBA Round One Deadline: 10/18/23
▶️ MSBA Round One Deadline: 10/4/23

Will AI eat your job? As you gain clients, will your product have diminishing returns, or will it become exponentially more valuable? And what if you run a bricks and mortar business that survived Amazon.com - will you make it through this latest round of AI tech change?

I highly recommend "Competing in the Age of AI" by Iansiti and Lakhani of Harvard Business School, especially if you are a normal human, a business executive, or an MBA - you don't have to be a data scientist to understand. They weave strategy and data science together to show how, for example, something like Facebook becomes more valuable with more users, while other products lose their shine.  

This is one of the textbooks we're using in our UC Davis MSBA program this fall. Our students learn not only Python and data visualization, but also the underlying business strategy and how to make money from these things. 

Anybody else have a book on the subject they would recommend?

#got_ucdavis_msba #ucdavis #msba #strategy #ai

https://lnkd.in/gmKbtWwK

Did your last highly technical presentation put the whole team to sleep? Worried that you left the audience dazed and confused?

There is a better way. We use Bill Franks' Winning The Room  textbook to teach our students how to communicate highly technical stuff to a business audience.

One sneak peek: on p. 173, Bill says, 'Put the cause on the X-axis.' Why is this so helpful? Most humans intuitively look on the bottom of a graph for the quantity they can control, and then look up on the side for the result. Laying out your graphs in this manner aligns the technical display with the intuitive expectations of your audience.  (Inspired?  Get your own copy here:  https://lnkd.in/gseB-jya) 

Our graduates are able to not only crunch your data and uncover the story, but are also able to communicate that to a business audience.

#got_ucdavis_msba #communication #businessanalytics Bill Franks
Your path to AI and Data Analysis Excellence - with some California cheese and Swiss chocolate to boot.  What more could a busy executive want?  #AI #IOT  #DataAnalytics #ExecutiveEducation

Congratulations to Walmart, the 2023 Franz Edelman prize winner! #informs2023 #analytics - and congratulations to all of the Edelman finalists. You are all truly saving money, doing good, saving lives.

For you lawyers and poets out there, Walmart won THE analytics competition by using math and computers to put the right stuff on the right shelf at the right time, and use the right truck to get it there.  This problem gets super hard when you have a whole bunch of stores and need to do it fast, and so they solved that too.

Thanks to Walmart’s analytics, the parents of the world won’t run out of diaper wipes and the artists never run out of duct tape. The lawyers will always find printer paper, and the poets will never run out of inspiration.

Operations research and analytics: the science of better.

Repost.Original Post Description:
I'm excited to share an article recently written about a project I did with the ridesharing company Lyft. If you used the Lyft app in the last year or so, anywhere in the US or Canada, the algorithm we wrote helped find the best available driver for your trip. Feel free to take a look if you want to understand what happens behind the curtain when you request a ride!

We used online reinforcement learning to learn how to better match drivers to passengers in real-time and constantly improve, a first for ridesharing companies.

The project was challenging, as it took over a year to make the algorithm work and obtain the required buy-in from across the company. However, the results were well worth the effort and benefit everyone: passengers are happier (more 5-star reviews and a 13 percent decrease of situations where no driver is available to pick up a customer), drivers are busier, and the new algorithm generated over $30 million a year in increased revenue.

The project is currently a finalist in the INFORMS Franz Edelman award, thanks to the effort of Lyft’s incredible team:

Xabier AZAGIRRE, Nicholas Chamandy, Benjamin Han, Vijay Narasiman, Zhiwei (Tony) Qin, Akshay Balwally, Guillaume Candeli, Alona King, Hyungjun Lee, Martin Loncaric, Baptiste Richard, Sara Smoot, Sean Taylor, Garrett van Ryzin, Di Wu, Alex Zamoshchin

Post Description:
Does the 35% project success rate seem high or low to you? #machinelearning  #projectmanagement  #oops 

Thank you Neelam Hussain-Mills  for raising the issue!

Repost.Original Post Description:
Only 35% of projects today are completed successfully. This is about to change! Researchers, startups, and innovating organizations, are beginning to apply AI, machine learning, and other advanced technologies to project management, and by 2030 the field will undergo major shifts.

Antonia Nieto - Rodriguez at HBR shows how organizations that want to reap the benefits of project management technologies should begin today by gathering and cleaning project data, preparing their people, and dedicating the resources necessary to drive this transformation. #people #machinelearning #change

Repost.Original Post Description:
I have a new post on five things I've added to my network design talk.  I really liked the classic material in the talk, but it was time to enhance it.   

Here are the five:
1. Gurobi Optimization's Burrito Game
2. Hidden Objectives (multi-objective and hierarchal optimization)
3. More on risk, including Jeff Camm's idea the hard work of scenario generation.
4. Value in the just the model building
5. Darin Buelow's write-up of the site selection for Micron's new fab plant.

Here's the link to the full article:
https://lnkd.in/gFSgwcVT

Post Description: Negotiation is an important part of everybody's business!  Thank you Alice Shikina for this presentation.

Repost.Original Post Description:
You negotiate almost EVERY single day.

You negotiate in relationships, friendships, at work, at home, with strangers, and sometimes even while driving!

Because of this, you need to have an understanding of what is non-negotiable and what is. You need to be prepared for objections to your proposals to respond with empathy and tact.

Want to know how to do this? Well, you're in luck!

I want to give a special thanks to Russ Catanach and Greg Louie for having me on the DIY for Business Podcast.

In this episode, I discuss the above to help you accelerate your negotiation journey and be more persuasive as an executive, manager, employee, spouse, and much more!

#negotiationtraining #managementskills #conflictmanagement

Post Description: Hi all - would you take 5 minutes and do me the favor of filling out the words that describe your job titles?

Post Description: Business networking survey question - can you help by filling this out?

Repost.Original Post Description:
Please do me a favor and complete this survey. 🙂

You have a new referral you could send to Alpha or Beta.  What would you do?

Hypothetical assumptions...
> 3 people - You, Alpha, and Beta
> Alpha and Beta solve the same problem for pay
> You believe you can trust each to do a good job
> You believe each could refer you an IDEAL client.
> Your network equally vouches for Alpha and Beta

> All the acts you have taken
1. You made 3 referrals in the last 12 months to Alpha that closed and were IDEAL for them.

> All the acts Alpha has taken 
2. Alpha solved the problems you referred efficiently, at the cost quoted, in the time quoted, and to the satisfaction of the problem haver you referred.
3. Alpha thanked you in a phone call when each referral closed
4. Every time you encounter Alpha they are friendly.

> All the acts Beta has taken
5. Every time you encounter Beta they are friendly.

There are no other acts that anyone has taken.

Post Description:
TL;DR - submit to the Wagner Prize by May 2

The Daniel H. Wagner Prize for Excellence in the Practice of Advanced Analytics and Operations Research is awarded to author or authors of a work that best exemplifies excellence in writing, clarity in presentation, innovation in analysis, and practical success.

This prize emphasizes the quality and coherence of the analysis used in practice and honors the memory of the late Dr. Daniel H. Wagner, a member of ORSA, then INFORMS for more than forty years. Dr. Wagner strove for strong mathematics applied to practical problems, supported by clear and intelligible writing. This prize recognizes those principles by emphasizing good writing, clear presentations, strong analytical content, and verifiable practice successes over quantitative benefits. Submission Deadline is May 2, 2021.

For complete details please visit:  https://lnkd.in/gv4iBJZ

You're invited!  

Dr. Ann Steiner's Book Launch this Saturday at Book Passages Corte Madera (California)

 
If you are in town this Saturday, you are invited to help celebrate the launch of my book Help Your Group Thrive: A Workbook and Planning Guide, published by Routledge Books, London.
 

Where: Book Passage in Corte Madera
Address: 51 Tamal Vista Blvd, Corte Madera, CA
When:July 14th from 7-9 pm ...Bastille Day!
 

Help Your Group Thrive: A Workbook and Planning Guideis for leaders of work groups, coaches, managers, book and service clubs. Leaders of community organizations, self-help groups, writer’s and critique groups, and students of the social sciences, will find it a valuable resource. As with my popular book for therapists, this workbook and planning guide includes an overview of different kinds of groups, leadership strategies, tips for dealing with common group challenges, numerous modifiable forms and more.
 

* Please forward this invitation to friends, family, colleagues and others who may be interested.*
 

FYI: The book seller will have the books for sale. They are also available from Amazon or the publisher, Routledge: 20% Discount Code: FLR 40
